subject: Sexual Health
title: Emergency Contraception
description: A fast breakdown of Emergency Contraception for builders.

hook.text: A pill taken within 72 hours after unprotected sex can prevent pregnancy. It was a medical milestone.

buildup.text: Emergency contraception works mainly by delaying or preventing ovulation, not by ending a pregnancy.

discovery.text: Plan B became available over the counter in the US in 2006, removing the need for a prescription.

twist.text: Despite being safe and effective, emergency contraception remains controversial and restricted in many countries.

climax.text: Access to emergency contraception reduces unintended pregnancies without affecting long-term fertility.

punchline.text: A second chance within a narrow time window.

quiz.question: How does emergency contraception primarily work?
